intro: Psoralea enneaphylla, commonly known as the nine-leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of nine leaflets, which is a distinguishing feature. Psoralea enneaphylla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
